ApiName.description: The name of the API operation.

ResourceGroupId.description: The ID of the resource group.

Content.description: The parameters in the API operation template.

ApplicationName.description: The name of the application. You can view the application names of each EMR version on the cluster creation page in the EMR console.
The name of the application. You can view the application names of each EMR version on the cluster creation page in the EMR console.

ConfigFileName.description: The name of the configuration file.

ConfigItemKey.description: The key of the configuration item.

ConfigItemValue.description: The value of the configuration item.

ConfigScope.description:
The level at which you want to apply the configurations. Valid values:

*   CLUSTER
*   NODE_GROUP

Default value: CLUSTER.

NodeGroupName.description: The name of the node group. This parameter takes effect only when the ConfigScope parameter is set to NODE_GROUP and the NodeGroupId parameter is not configured.

NodeGroupId.description: The node group ID. This parameter takes effect only when the ConfigScope parameter is set to NODE_GROUP. The NodeGroupId parameter has a higher priority than the NodeGroupName parameter.

ClusterType.description:
The type of the cluster. Valid values:

*   DATALAKE
*   OLAP
*   DATAFLOW
*   DATASERVING
*   CUSTOM
*   HADOOP

ClusterState.description:
The status of the cluster. Valid values:

*   STARTING
*   START_FAILED
*   BOOTSTRAPPING
*   RUNNING
*   TERMINATING
*   TERMINATED
*   TERMINATED_WITH_ERRORS
*   TERMINATE_FAILED

StateChangeReason.description: The reason of the cluster status change.

PaymentType.description:
The billing method. Valid values:

*   PayAsYouGo
*   Subscription

CreateTime.description: The timestamp when the cluster is created. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

ReadyTime.description: The timestamp when the cluster starts to be available. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

EndTime.description: The timestamp when the cluster is deleted. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

ExpireTime.description: The timestamp when the cluster expires. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

DeployMode.description:
The deployment mode of master nodes in the cluster. Valid values:

*   NORMAL: regular mode
*   HA: high availability mode

SecurityMode.description:
The security mode of the cluster. Valid values:

*   NORMAL: regular mode. Kerberos is not enabled.
*   KERBEROS: Kerberos mode. Kerberos is enabled.

DeletionProtection.description: Indicates whether the release protection is enabled. Valid values: true and false.

Code.description:
The status code. Valid values:

*   UserRequest: A user request is initiated.
*   OutOfStock: The ECS instances of the requested type are out of stock.
*   NotAuthorized: The required permission is not granted.
*   QuotaExceeded: The quota is exceeded.
*   OperationDenied: The operation is denied.
*   AccountException: The account is abnormal.
*   NodeFailure: The ECS instance is abnormal.
*   BootstrapFailure: The bootstrap action fails.
*   ValidationFail: The business logic verification fails.
*   ServiceFailure: Other services on which the current service depends fail.
*   InternalError: An internal error occurs.

Message.description: The information about the cluster status change.
Message.example: The requested resource is sold out in the specified zone, try other types of resources or other regions and zones.

*   DATALAKE
*   OLAP

*   DATASERVING

*   STARTING
*   START_FAILED
*   BOOTSTRAPPING
*   RUNNING
*   TERMINATING
*   TERMINATED
*   TERMINATED_WITH_ERRORS

The billing method. Valid values:

*   PayAsYouGo
*   Subscription

ReadyTime.description: The time when the cluster is available.

StateChangeReason.description: The reason of the cluster status change.

RunActionScope.description:
The execution scope. Valid values:

*   APPLICATION
*   COMPONENT
*   COMPONENT_INSTANCE

Components.description: The components. This parameter takes effect only when the RunActionScope parameter is set to COMPONENT.

ComponentInstances.description: The component instances. This parameter takes effect only when the RunActionScope parameter is set to COMPONENT_INSTANCE.

CostOptimizedConfig.description: The configurations of the cost optimization policy.

OnDemandBaseCapacity.description: The minimum number of pay-as-you-go instances that are required for the node group. Valid values: 0 to 1000. If the number of pay-as-you-go instances is less than the value of this parameter, pay-as-you-go instances are preferentially created.

OnDemandPercentageAboveBaseCapacity.description: The percentage of pay-as-you-go instances among the instances that exceed the number specified by the OnDemandBaseCapacity parameter for the node group. Valid values: 0 to 100.

SpotInstancePools.description: The number of instance types that are specified. Preemptible instances of multiple instance types that are provided at the lowest price are evenly created in the scaling group. Valid values: 0 to 10.

Category.description:
The disk type. Valid values:

*   cloud_efficiency: ultra disk
*   cloud_ssd: standard SSD
*   cloud_essd: enhanced SSD (ESSD)
*   cloud: basic disk

PerformanceLevel.description:
The performance level of the ESSD that is used as the data disk. Valid values:

*   PL0: A single ESSD can provide up to 10,000 random read/write IOPS.
*   PL1: A single ESSD can provide up to 50,000 random read/write IOPS.
*   PL2: A single ESSD can provide up to 100,000 random read/write IOPS.
*   PL3: A single ESSD can provide up to 1,000,000 random read/write IOPS.

Default value: PL1.

InstanceTypeFamily.description: The instance family to which the instance type belongs. For information about the valid values of InstanceTypeFamily, see [DescribeInstanceTypeFamilies](~~25621~~).

InstanceType.description: The instance type of the ECS instance. For more information, see [Overview of ECS instance families](~~25378~~).

Optimized.description:
Indicates whether the instance is I/O optimized. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

InstanceCategory.description:
The category of the instance type. Valid values:

*   General-purpose
*   Compute-optimized
*   Memory-optimized
*   Big data
*   Local SSDs
*   High Clock Speed
*   Enhanced
*   Shared
*   Compute-optimized with GPU
*   Visual Compute-optimized
*   Heterogeneous Service
*   Compute-optimized with FPGA
*   Compute-optimized with NPU
*   ECS Bare Metal
*   Super Computing Cluster

CpuArchitecture.description:
The CPU architecture. Valid values:

*   X86
*   ARM

LocalStorageCapacity.description: The capacity of each local disk attached per instance. Unit: GiB.

LocalStorageAmount.description: The number of local disks per instance.

TimeWindow.description: The time window for statistics. This parameter is required. Unit: seconds. Valid values: 30 to 1800.

EvaluationCount.description: The number of times that the statistics are collected. This parameter is required. Valid values: 1 to 5.

CoolDownInterval.description: The cooldown interval. Unit: seconds. Valid values: 0 to 10800.

ConditionLogicOperator.description:
The logical relationship between multiple metrics. Valid values:

*   And
*   Or (default)

Conditions.description: The trigger conditions for the metric.

NodeGroupType.description:
The type of the node group. Valid values:

*   MASTER
*   CORE
*   TASK

InstanceType.description: The instance type. You can call the [DescribeInstanceTypes](~~25620~~) operation of the ECS service to obtain available instance types.

NodeState.description:
The status of the node. Valid values:

*   Pending: The node is being created.
*   Starting: The node is being started.
*   Running: The node is running.
*   Stopping: The node is being stopped.
*   Stopped: The node is stopped.
*   Terminated: The node is terminated.

MaintenanceStatus.description:
The status of the O\&M mode. Valid values:

*   ON: The cluster is in O\&M mode.
*   OFF: The cluster is not in O\&M mode.

If you do not configure this parameter, the cluster is not in O\&M mode.

ExpireTime.description: The expiration time of the node.

AutoRenew.description:
Indicates whether auto-renewal is enabled for the node. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

AutoRenewDuration.description: The auto-renewal duration for the node.

AutoRenewDurationUnit.description: The unit of the auto-renewal duration for the node.

CreateTime.description: The creation time of the node.

SecurityGroupId.description: The security group ID. E-MapReduce (EMR) supports only basic security groups.

RamRole.description: The RAM role that you want to associate with EMR to access other Alibaba Cloud resources from Elastic Compute Service (ECS). Default value: AliyunECSInstanceForEMRRole.

KeyPairName.description: The SSH key pair that is used to log on to the ECS instance.

MasterRootPassword.description: The password of the root user that you use to log on to the master node. If this parameter is used as the response parameter of the API operation, no value is returned.

NodeGroupName.description: The name of the node group.

NodeGroupType.description:
The type of the node group. Valid values:

*   MASTER
*   CORE
*   TASK
*   GATEWAY This parameter is invalid for DataLake, OLAP, and DataServing clusters.

PaymentType.description: The billing method. Valid values: Subscription and PayAsYouGo.

NodeGroupState.description: The status of the node group.

WithPublicIp.description: Indicates whether a public IP address is assigned.

SpotStrategy.description:
The usage policy of the spot instance. Valid values:

*   NoSpot: No spot instances are used.
*   SpotWithPriceLimit: Spot instances with a custom maximum price are used.
*   SpotAsPriceGo: Spot instances are used. The system automatically adjusts the upper limit of the price. The maximum price does not exceed the price of a pay-as-you-go instance.

Default value: NoSpot.

SpotBidPrices.description: The bid prices of the preemptible instances. The parameter takes effect only if the SpotStrategy parameter is set to SpotWithPriceLimit. Number of elements in the array: 0 to 100.

items.description: The bid prices of the preemptible instances.

StateChangeReason.description: The reason of the status change.
StateChangeReason.example:
Specifies whether to enable graceful shutdown for components in the node group. Valid values:

*   true
*   false: does not enable graceful disconnection.

GracefulShutdown.description:
Indicates whether graceful shutdown is enabled for services in the node group. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

SpotInstanceRemedy.description:
Indicates whether preemptible instances are supplemented. If you set this parameter to true, the system attempts to create another instance in the scaling group when the system notifies that an existing preemptible instance is about to be reclaimed. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

Default value: false.

CostOptimizedConfig.description: The configurations of the cost optimization policy.

DeploymentSetStrategy.description:
The deployment set policy. Valid values:

*   NONE: No deployment sets are used.
*   CLUSTER: Deployment sets at the cluster level are used.
*   NODE_GROUP: Deployment sets at the node group level are used.

Default value: NONE.

PrivatePoolOptions.description: The settings of the private pool that is associated with the node group.

Status.description: The status of the node group.

NodeGroupType.description:
The type of the node group. Valid values:

*   MASTER
*   CORE
*   TASK

NodeGroupName.description: The name of the node group. The name can be up to 128 characters in length. The name of a node group must be unique in a cluster.

PaymentType.description:
The billing method of the node group. If you do not configure this parameter, the billing method of the cluster is used. Valid values:

*   PayAsYouGo
*   Subscription

Default value: PayAsYouGo.

SubscriptionConfig.description: The configurations of the node group based on the subscription billing method. If you do not configure this parameter, the configurations of the cluster based on the subscription billing method are used.

SpotStrategy.description:
The bidding policy for the preemptible instance. Valid values:

*   NoSpot: The instance is created as a regular pay-as-you-go instance.
*   SpotWithPriceLimit: The instance is a preemptible instance for which you specify the highest price that you want to pay for the instance.
*   SpotAsPriceGo: The instance is a preemptible instance for which the market price is automatically used as the bid price. The highest market price is the pay-as-you-go price.

Default value: NoSpot.

SpotBidPrices.description: The bid prices of the preemptible instances. The parameter takes effect only if the SpotStrategy parameter is set to SpotWithPriceLimit. Number of elements in the array: 0 to 100.

VSwitchIds.description: The vSwitch IDs. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 20.

WithPublicIp.description:
Indicates whether a public IP address is assigned. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

Default value: false.

AdditionalSecurityGroupIds.description: The additional security group IDs. Additional security groups are the security groups that are separately added to a node group. Number of elements in the array: 0 to 2.

InstanceTypes.description: The instance types of the nodes. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 100.

items.description: The instance type of the node.

NodeCount.description: The number of nodes. Valid values: 1 to 1000.

DataDisks.description: The data disks. Only one disk type is supported. You can specify only one element in the array.

GracefulShutdown.description:
Indicates whether graceful shutdown is enabled for services in the node group. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

Default value: false.

SpotInstanceRemedy.description:
Indicates whether preemptible instances are supplemented. If you set this parameter to true, the system attempts to create another instance in the scaling group when the system notifies that an existing preemptible instance is about to be reclaimed. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

Default value: false.

NodeResizeStrategy.description:
The scaling policy for the node. Valid values:

*   COST_OPTIMIZED
*   PRIORITY

Default value: PRIORITY.

CostOptimizedConfig.description: The configurations of the cost optimization policy.

The deployment set policy. Valid values:

*   NONE: No deployment sets are used.
*   CLUSTER: Deployment sets at the cluster level are used.
*   NODE_GROUP: Deployment sets at the node group level are used.

Default value: NONE.

PrivatePoolOptions.description: The resource reservation policy of the node group. This parameter takes effects only for pay-as-you-go node groups.

MaxCapacity.description: The maximum number of nodes in the node group. Default value: 2000.

MinCapacity.description: The minimum number of nodes in the node group. Default value: 0

ScalingRule.description: The configurations of the scaling rule.

RuleName.description: The name of the scaling rule. This parameter is required and cannot be an empty string.

TriggerType.description:
The trigger mode of the scaling rule. This parameter is required. Valid values:

*   TIME_TRIGGER: time-based scaling
*   METRICS_TRIGGER: load-based scaling

ActivityType.description:
The scaling type. This parameter is required. Valid values:

*   SCALE_OUT
*   SCALE_IN

AdjustmentValue.description: The adjustment value of the scaling rule. This parameter is required. The parameter value must be a positive integer, which indicates the number of instances that you want to add or remove.

MinAdjustmentValue.description: The minimum number of instances that must be added in a scale-out activity.

ScriptName.description: The name of the script. This parameter is required. The name must be 1 to 64 characters in length and must start with a letter. The name cannot start with http:// or https://. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores (\_), and hyphens (-).

ScriptPath.description: The Object Storage Service (OSS) path in which the script is stored. This parameter is required. The path must start with oss://.

ScriptArgs.description: The runtime parameters of the script. This parameter is optional.

Priority.description: >  This parameter is deprecated. The sequence in which scripts are executed is the same as the sequence in which scripts are defined.

ExecutionMoment.description:
The time based on which the system executes the script. Valid values:

*   BEFORE_INSTALL: The system executes the script before the application is installed.
*   AFTER_STARTED: The system executes the script after the application is started.

ExecutionFailStrategy.description:
The policy that is used to handle an execution failure of the script. Valid values:

*   FAILED_CONTINUE: After the script fails to be executed, the system continues to perform the creation or scale-out operation on the cluster.
*   FAILED_BLOCK: After the script fails to be executed, the system stops performing the creation or scale-out operation on the cluster.

InstanceType.description: The type of the ECS instance.

BidPrice.description: The maximum hourly bid price of the instance. It can be accurate to three decimal places. This parameter is valid only when the SpotStrategy parameter is set to SpotWithPriceLimit.

Code.description:
The status code. Valid values:

*   UserRequest: A user request is initiated.
*   QuotaExceeded: The quota is exceeded.
*   InternalError: An internal error occurs.

PaymentDurationUnit.description:
The unit of the subscription duration. Valid values:

*   Month

PaymentDuration.description: The subscription duration. Valid values when PaymentDurationUnit is set to Month: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 60.

AutoRenew.description:
Indicates whether auto-renewal is enabled. Valid values:

*   true
*   false Default value: false.

AutoRenewDurationUnit.description:
The unit of the auto-renewal duration. Valid values:

*   Month

AutoRenewDuration.description: The auto-renewal duration. This parameter takes effect only when the AutoRenew parameter is set to true. Valid values when AutoRenewDurationUnit is set to Month: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 60.

Category.description:
The disk type. Valid values:

*   cloud_efficiency: ultra disk
*   cloud_ssd: standard SSD
*   cloud_essd: enhanced SSD
*   cloud: basic disk

PerformanceLevel.description:
The performance level of the ESSD that is used as the system disk. Valid values:

*   PL0: A single ESSD can provide up to 10,000 random read/write IOPS.
*   PL1: A single ESSD can provide up to 50,000 random read/write IOPS.
*   PL2: A single ESSD can provide up to 100,000 random read/write IOPS.
*   PL3: A single ESSD can provide up to 1,000,000 random read/write IOPS.

Default value: PL1.

Count.description: The number of system disks on each node. Default value: 1.

Key.description: The key of the tag. This parameter is required and cannot be an empty string. The key can be up to 128 characters in length. It cannot start with `aliyun` or `acs:` and cannot contain `http://` or `https://`.

Value.description: The value of the tag This parameter is optional and can be an empty string. The value can be up to 128 characters in length. It cannot start with `acs:` and cannot contain `http://` or `https://`.

StartTime.description: The start time. Valid values: 00:00 to 23:59.

EndTime.description: The end time. Valid values: 00:00 to 23:59.

LaunchTime.description: The execution time of the scaling rule. This parameter is required. The value is a string in the HH:MM format.

StartTime.description: The timestamp that specifies the start time. This parameter is required. Unit: milliseconds.

EndTime.description: The timestamp that specifies the end time. Unit: milliseconds.

LaunchExpirationTime.description: The time period during which a scheduled task can be retried after it fails. Unit: seconds. Valid values: 0 to 3600.

RecurrenceType.description:
The frequency of executing the specified rule whose trigger mode is scaling by time. Valid values:

*   DAILY
*   WEEKLY
*   MONTHLY

RecurrenceValue.description:
The number of recurrences of the scheduled task. The value of this parameter depends on the value of RecurrenceType.

*   If the RecurrenceType parameter is set to DAILY, you can specify only one value for this parameter. Valid values: 1 to 31.
*   If the RecurrenceType parameter is set to WEEKLY, you can specify multiple values for this parameter and separate them with commas (,). The values MON, TUE, WED, THU, FRI, SAT, and SUN indicate the days from Monday to Sunday. For example, the value MON,FRI,SUN stands for Monday, Friday, and Sunday.
*   If the RecurrenceType parameter is set to MONTHLY, the value of this parameter is in the A-B or A,B format. The values of A and B are both in the range of 1 to 31. If you use the A-B format, the value of B must be greater than the value of A.

MetricName.description: The name of the metric. This parameter is required and cannot be an empty string. You can view the metric name in [Add Auto Scaling Rules](~~445658~~).

Tags.description: The tags for the metrics of a partition. This parameter is available for only metrics that contain ByPartition. For other metrics, leave this parameter empty.

Statistics.description:
The name of the statistic. This parameter is required. Valid values:

*   MAX
*   MIN
*   AVG

ComparisonOperator.description:
The comparison operator. This parameter is required. Valid values:

*   EQ: equal to
*   NE: not equal to
*   GT: greater than
*   LT: less than
*   GE: greater than or equal to
*   LE: less than or equal to

Threshold.description: The trigger threshold. This parameter is required.

ConfigFileName.description: The name of the application configuration file.

ConfigItemKey.description: The key of the configuration item.

ConfigItemValue.description: The value of the configuration item.

schema.description: The ID of the resource group.

schema.title: 付费类型。
schema.description:
The billing method of the cluster. Valid values:

*   PayAsYouGo
*   Subscription

Default value: PayAsYouGo.
The subscription configurations. This parameter is required only if you set the PaymentType parameter to Subscription.

schema.title: 集群类型。
schema.description:
The type of the cluster. Valid values:

*   DATALAKE
*   OLAP
*   DATAFLOW
*   DATASERVING
*   CUSTOM
*   HADOOP: We recommend that you set this parameter to DATALAKE rather than HADOOP.

If the first time you create an EMR cluster is after 17:00 (UTC+8) on December 19, 2022, you cannot create a Hadoop, Data Science, Presto, or ZooKeeper cluster.

schema.title: EMR发行版。
schema.description: The EMR version. You can query available EMR versions in the EMR console.

schema.title: 集群名称。
schema.description: The cluster name. The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length. The name must start with a letter but cannot start with http:// or https://. The name can contain letters, digits, colons (:), underscores (\_), periods (.), and hyphens (-).

schema.title: 部署模式。
schema.description:
The deployment mode of master nodes in the cluster. Valid values:

*   NORMAL: regular mode. This is the default value. A cluster that contains only one master node is created.
*   HA: high availability mode. A cluster that contains at least three master nodes is created.

schema.title: Kerberos安全模式。
schema.description:
The security mode of the cluster. Valid values:

*   NORMAL: regular mode. Kerberos authentication is disabled. This is the default value.
*   KERBEROS: Kerberos mode. Kerberos authentication is enabled.

schema.title: 应用列表。
schema.description: The list of services. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 100.

schema.title: 应用配置。
schema.description: The service configurations. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 1,000.
The basic attributes of all ECS instances in the cluster.

schema.description: The node groups. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 100.

schema.title: 引导脚本。
schema.description: The bootstrap actions. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 10.

schema.title: 标签。
schema.description: The list of tags. Number of elements in the array: 0 to 20.

schema.description: The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. The same ClientToken value for multiple calls to the RunCluster operation results in identical responses. Only one cluster can be created by using the same ClientToken value.

RunCluster.title: RunCluster
RunCluster.summary: Creates a pay-as-you-go or subscription E-MapReduce (EMR) cluster.
RunCluster.description: RunCluster is an upgraded version of CreateCluster. RunCluster uses HTTPS POST requests and supports more parameters. Complex parameters, such as parameters of the object and array types, are in the JSON format and are more friendly for users who use CLI.

schema.title: 资源组ID。
schema.description: The ID of the resource group to which to assign the ENI.

schema.title: 付费类型。
schema.description:
The billing cycle of the instance. Valid values:

*   PayAsYouGo: pay-as-you-go
*   Subscription: subscription

Default value: PayAsYouGo.

schema.title: 预付费配置。
schema.description: The subscription configurations. This parameter is required only if you set the PaymentType parameter to Subscription.

schema.title: 集群类型。
schema.description:
The type of the cluster. Valid values:

*   DATALAKE: data lake
*   OLAP: online analytical processing (OLAP)
*   DATAFLOW: Dataflow
*   DATASERVING: DataServing
*   CUSTOM: a custom hybrid cluster.
*   HADOOP: the old data lake. We recommend that you use the new data lake.

If you create an EMR cluster for the first time after 17:00 (UTC +8) on December 19, 2022, you cannot select the HADOOP, DATA_SCIENCE, PRESTO, or ZOOKEEPER cluster type.

schema.title: EMR发行版。
schema.description: The EMR version. You can query available E-MapReduce (EMR) versions in the EMR console.

schema.title: 集群名称。
schema.description: The name of the cluster. The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length. It must start with a letter and cannot start with http:// or https://. It can contain letters, digits, colons (:), underscores (\_), periods (.), and hyphens (-).

schema.title: 部署模式。
schema.description:
The deployment mode of master nodes in the cluster. Valid values:

*   NORMAL: regular mode. This is the default value. A cluster that contains only one master node is created.
*   HA: high availability (HA) mode. A cluster that contains three master nodes is created.

schema.title: Kerberos安全模式。
schema.description:
The security mode of the cluster. Valid values:

*   NORMAL: disables Kerberos authentication for the cluster. This is the default value.
*   KERBEROS: enables Kerberos authentication for the cluster.

schema.title: 应用列表。
schema.description: The services. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 100.

schema.title: 应用配置。
schema.description: The service configurations. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 1000.

schema.title: 节点属性。
schema.description: The attributes of all ECS instances. The basic attributes of all ECS instances in the cluster.

schema.title: 节点组。
schema.description: The node groups. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 100.

schema.title: 引导脚本。
schema.description: The bootstrap actions. Number of elements in the array: 1 to 10.

schema.title: 标签。
schema.description: The list of tags. Number of elements in the array: 0 to 20.

schema.title: 幂等客户端TOKEN。
schema.description: The idempotent client token. If you call the same ClientToken multiple times, the returned results are the same. Only one cluster can be created with the same ClientToken.

The minimum number of nodes that can be added. Valid values: 1 to 500.

*   If you configure this parameter, and the number of available Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances is less than the value of the IncreaseNodeCount parameter, the system tries to add nodes based on the number specified by the `MinIncreaseNodeCount` parameter. If the minimum number of nodes are added, the scale-out status is `PARTIAL_COMPLETED`.
*   If you do not configure this parameter, and the number of available ECS instances is less than the value of the IncreaseNodeCount parameter, the scale-out process fails. The scale-out status is `FAILED`.

schema.title: component type
schema.description:
Select component filter type. Values: 
- compute 
- hive
- hdfs
- yarn
- oss
- hbase

Summary.example:
[计算检测] 计算健康度分数为 88 ，健康度良好，继续加油

集群中大部分任务保持健康状态

集群内存利用率为： 47.8% 偏低

Suggestion.example:
计算健康度分数为 88 ，集群处于健康状态，继续保持 
计算任务扫描
对集群中 1518 个计算任务进行了扫描，包含 209 个任务处于不健康状态 ，596 个任务处于亚健康状态 ，713 个任务处于健康状态。 
其中：
       Tez 任务 1518 个，加权平均分为 88 ，内存使用量占整体集群的 100.0% ，CPU 使用量占整体集群的 100.0% ，其中 209 个任务处于不健康状态，596 个任务处于亚健康状态；
可在下面的任务明细列表中点击''查看详情''，查看存在的具体问题及解决方案。其中''低分任务算力内存时 (GB*Sec)Top20 ''表根据内存时使用量进行排序，由于大任务对集群整体影响可能更大，建议优先关注。
内存利用率较低
集群整体内存利用率为 47.8% ，内存利用率较低，计算资源存在浪费，建议优先对内存算力时较大且内存利用率较低的 TOP 任务进行优化
其中，Tez作业平均内存利用率为 47.8%

The resource types, which are used to filter query results. Valid values:

*   engine: filters results by engine.
*   queue: filters results by queue.
*   cluster: displays the results at the cluster level.

If you do not specify this parameter, the information at the cluster level is displayed by default. Currently, only one resource type is supported. If you specify multiple resource types, the first resource type is used by default.

The order in which you want to sort the query results. Valid values:

*   ASC: in ascending order.
*   DESC: in descending order.

The basis on which you want to sort the query results. Valid values:

1.  vcoreSeconds: the total CPU consumption over time in seconds.
2.  memSeconds: the total memory consumption over time in seconds.
3.  vcoreUtilization: the average CPU utilization. The meaning is the same as the %CPU parameter in the output of the top command in Linux.
4.  memUtilization: the average memory usage.
5.  vcoreSecondsDayGrowthRatio: the day-to-day growth rate of the total CPU consumption over time in seconds.
6.  memSecondsDayGrowthRatio: the day-to-day growth rate of the total memory consumption over time in seconds.
7.  readSize: the total amount of data read from the file system.
8.  writeSize: the total amount of data written to the file system.
9.  healthyJobCount: the total number of healthy jobs.
10. subHealthyJobCount: the total number of sub-healthy jobs.
11. unhealthyJobCount: the total number of unhealthy jobs.
12. needAttentionJobCount: the total number of jobs that require attention.
13. score: the score for jobs.
14. scoreDayGrowthRatio: the day-to-day growth rate of the score for jobs.

3.  vcoreUtilization: the vCPU utilization of the job
4.  memUtilization: the memory usage of the job
5.  vcoreSeconds: the aggregated number of vCPUs that are allocated to the job multiplied by the number of seconds the job has been running
6.  memSeconds: the aggregated amount of memory that is allocated to the job multiplied by the number of seconds the job has been running
7.  score: the score of the job
